Q&A pairs.subject: WLSH ComfyUI Nodes
Q&A pairs.question: What are WLSH ComfyUI Nodes?
Q&A pairs.answer: WLSH ComfyUI Nodes is a set of custom nodes for ComfyUI created for personal use to solve minor annoyances or implement various features.

Q&A pairs.subject: Checkpoint Loader with Name
Q&A pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Checkpoint Loader with Name node?
Q&A pairs.answer: The Checkpoint Loader with Name is a regular checkpoint loader with an output that provides the name of the loaded model as a string for use in saving filenames.

Q&A pairs.subject: KSamplerAdvanced (WLSH)
Q&A pairs.question: What is unique about the KSamplerAdvanced node?
Q&A pairs.answer: KSamplerAdvanced (WLSH) is a modified version of the advanced KSampler that returns the 'denoising' option for experimentation. It also provides the INFO output that provides sampler settings for use in other nodes.

Q&A pairs.subject: CLIP Positive-Negative w/Text
Q&A pairs.question: What is the function of the CLIP Positive-Negative w/Text node?
Q&A pairs.answer: CLIP Positive-Negative w/Text is a node that is similar to the original CLIP Positive-Negative, but with two output nodes to provide the positive and negative inputs to other nodes. It is also available as an SDXL version.

Q&A pairs.subject: Empty Latent by Pixels
Q&A pairs.question: What does the Empty Latent by Pixels node do?
Q&A pairs.answer: The Empty Latent by Pixels node allows users to quickly generate an empty latent by selecting an aspect ratio, an orientation, and the number of megapixels. It also provides the height and width as integers for plugging in elsewhere.

Q&A pairs.subject: Image Load with Metadata
Q&A pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Image Load with Metadata node?
Q&A pairs.answer: The Image Load with Metadata node extracts image metadata from Auto1111-sourced images or from images saved with nodes in this pack. It allows users to connect these outputs to other nodes and requires ComfyUI commit d7b3b0f8c11c6261d0d8b859ea98f2d818b7e67d or newer to show a preview of the selected image.

Q&A pairs.subject: Outpaint to Image
Q&A pairs.question: What does the Outpaint to Image node do?
Q&A pairs.answer: The Outpaint to Image node extends an image in a selected direction by a number of pixels and outputs the expanded image and a mask of the outpainted region with some blurred border padding.

Q&A pairs.subject: Image Scale by Factor
Q&A pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Image Scale by Factor node?
Q&A pairs.answer: The Image Scale by Factor node scales an image by a predefined factor without a model.

Q&A pairs.subject: Time String
Q&A pairs.question: What is the function of the Time String node?
Q&A pairs.answer: The Time String node returns a formatted string of the current time in the selected format, which can be useful for filenames or debugging.

Q&A pairs.subject: Image Save with Prompt
Q&A pairs.question: What does the Image Save with Prompt node do?
Q&A pairs.answer: The Image Save with Prompt node allows users to save an image with embedded metadata using a variety of input options, and it includes a 'counter' option for the integer counter (via primitive node with 'increment' option ideally). As far as I can tell, it does not remove the ComfyUI 'embed workflow' feature for PNG.

Q&A pairs.subject: Save Prompt
Q&A pairs.question: What does the Save Prompt node do?
Q&A pairs.answer: The Save Prompt node saves the prompts to a text file, along with info on model name and seed.
